task.description: Perform a comprehensive repo state analysis and maintain a sequential repository status log

requirements.requirement: Analyze all key directories in the repository such as prompts/ and docs/
Review existing repo-status entries for context before creating new entries
Assign monotonically increasing entry numbers to each new repo-status document
Create detailed documentation for each major component or folder in the repository
Document the project's goals and key features to ground state analysis in the app domain
Focus on architecture, dependencies, and how components work together
Track important developments, changes, and current state of integration

priority_guidelines.essential: Repository status must have accurate sequential numbering
All major components and directories must be analyzed and documented
priority_guidelines.important: Integration patterns must be clearly mapped
Recommendations must be actionable and prioritized
priority_guidelines.nice_to_have: Visual representations of architecture and data flows
priority_guidelines.optional: Historical trend analysis across multiple status entries

instructions.instruction: Check for existing repo-status entries to determine the next entry number
Review previous 3 entries to understand context and progress
Map the entire repo structure systematically
Identify which components or directories need documentation updates
Run dependency analysis tools if available

phase.output: Repository map with entry number and documentation gaps identified

instructions.instruction: For each major directory or component, create comprehensive documentation using the template
For each shared module or library, create API and implementation documentation
Map data flows and state management approaches
Synthesize findings into cohesive status report
Prioritize recommendations based on impact and effort
Update integration status and development log
Ensure continuity with previous status entries

phase.output: Complete repository status entry with all supporting documents

historical_context.instruction: Review patterns across last 5 status entries

team_context.instruction: Note any team structure or ownership changes

technical_context.instruction: Check for framework or library updates

anti_pattern.name: Analysis Paralysis
anti_pattern.signs: Very long reports, no clear next steps, theoretical discussions

anti_pattern.name: Documentation Drift
anti_pattern.description: Documentation becoming disconnected from actual code
anti_pattern.signs: Outdated examples, incorrect API descriptions, missing features
anti_pattern.prevention: Verify all documentation against current codebase

anti_pattern.name: Recommendation Amnesia
anti_pattern.description: Repeating same recommendations without tracking progress
anti_pattern.signs: Same issues in multiple reports, no progress tracking
anti_pattern.prevention: Always reference previous recommendations and their status

anti_pattern.name: Surface-Level Analysis
anti_pattern.description: Missing deep architectural issues by focusing on symptoms
anti_pattern.signs: Only noting obvious issues, missing root causes
anti_pattern.prevention: Dig deeper into patterns and systemic issues

template.mermaid_template:
```mermaid graph TB subgraph "Apps Layer" A1[App 1
Status: Active] A2[App 2
Status: Maintenance] A3[App 3
Status: Development] end
subgraph "Packages Layer" P1[@repo/ui
v2.1.0] P2[@repo/utils
v1.5.0] P3[@repo/core
v3.0.0] end
subgraph "External Dependencies" E1[React 18] E2[Node 20] E3[TypeScript 5] end
A1 --> P1 A1 --> P2 A2 --> P2 A2 --> P3 A3 --> P1 A3 --> P3
P1 --> E1 P2 --> E3 P3 --> E2 ```

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant U as User participant A as App Layer participant P as Package Layer participant D as Data Layer participant E as External API
U->>A: User Action A->>P: Process Request P->>D: Query Data D-->>P: Return Data P->>E: Fetch External E-->>P: API Response P-->>A: Processed Result A-->>U: Update UI ```

```mermaid graph LR subgraph "Circular Dependencies" C1[Package A] --> C2[Package B] C2 --> C3[Package C] C3 --> C1 end
subgraph "Healthy Dependencies" H1[App] --> H2[Feature Package] H2 --> H3[Core Package] H2 --> H4[Utils Package] end
style C1 fill:#f96 style C2 fill:#f96 style C3 fill:#f96 ```
